intro: Descurainia richardsonii subsp. incisa, commonly known as the narrow-leafed tansy, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, pinnately divided leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, typical of the mustard family. It is native to North America and thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. Its botanical features make it identifiable in ecological studies and plant identification guides.
